com.mvohm.quadruple.test

Class TesterClasses.QuadTester

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mvohm.quadruple.test.TesterClasses.QuadTester
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TesterClasses.QuadOpTester
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TesterClasses.BinaryFunctionTester, TesterClasses.UnaryFunctionTester
    Enclosing class:
    TesterClasses

    abstract static class TesterClasses.QuadTester
extends Object
implements TesterClasses.QuadOpTester
    Common ancestor for all tester classes.

    Implements public methods:
    • test() -- tests the operation with the default data set obtained via getTestDataList()
    • test(List) -- tests the operation with the given data set

    Defines abstract methods to be implemented by descendants:
    • getName() -- to return the tested operation name to be used in the report;
    • getTestDataList() -- to return the data set to be used in the test;
    • testOp(String[]) -- to test the operation on the given individual data sample.

    Implements protected methods to be used by descendants:
    • getThreshold() -- returns the default value of the tolerable error threshold for the test, 1.470e-39. May be overridden by descendants

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected TestResults results
      An instance of the TestResults class that accumulates the results of testing the operation on individual data samples.

      An implementation provided by a specific descendant tests a specific operation on the given data sample and registers the results in the instance of TestResults class held in the results variable of this instance of the tester.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        protected abstract String getName()
        An implementation provided by a specific descendant should return the name of the specific test to be used in the report and in error messages.
        Returns:
        the name of the tested operation

      • getTestDataList

        protected abstract List<String[]> getTestDataList()
        An implementation provided by a specific descendant should obtain and return a specific default dataset to test the specific operation being tested.
        Returns:
        a list of data samples to test the operation
        See Also:
        DataProviders

      • test

        public TestResults test()
        Tests the operation using the data from the default dataset provided by getTestDataList() method of a specific descendant.
        First creates an instance of TestResults to keep the results, then for each data sample from the default test data list calls the testOp(String[]) method, which performs the test on the data sample and registers its result in the TestResults, then forms and prints the report (if in talkative mode) and returns the TestResults instance.

        Specified by:
        test in interface TesterClasses.QuadOpTester
        Returns:
        an instance of TestResults with the results of the test

      • test

        public TestResults test(List<String[]> testData)
        Tests the operation using the data from a specific dataset passed in as a parameter.
        First creates an instance of TestResults to keep the results, then for each data sample from the testData list calls the testOp(String[]) method, which performs the test on the data sample and registers its result in the TestResults, then forms and prints the report (if in talkative mode) and returns the TestResults instance.

        Can be called instead of the test() method from an external code to test the operation on a specific custom data set.

        Specified by:
        test in interface TesterClasses.QuadOpTester
        Parameters:
        testData - the data to run the test on
        Returns:
        an instance of TestResults with the results of the test

      • testOp

        protected abstract void testOp(String[] dataSample)
        An implementation provided by a specific descendant tests a specific operation on the given data sample and registers the results in the instance of TestResults class held in the results variable of this instance of the tester.
        The data sample is expected to be an array of Strings where the first string or the first two strings contain string representations of the operands for the tested operation and the second (or the third) string contains the expected result of the tested operation. In most cases the expected result can be calculated by the instance of the tester class based on the value(s) of the argument(s). In such cases the element intended to hold the expected value can be null or an empty string.
        Parameters:
        dataSample - an array containing String representations of the input argument(s) of the tested operation and a string representation of the expected result

      • getThreshold

        protected static double getThreshold()
        Returns the value of the threshold of acceptable relative errors set for this instance.
        The default implementation returns the default value of the threshold, Consts.NORM_ERR_THRESH. Relative errors whose values don't exceed the threshold are inevitable for most operations and considered acceptable. Testers which deal with data types or operations that may produce greater relative errors may have to override this method to return another value.
        Returns:
        the value of the error threshold set for this instance
